page.title: 09Bower Hall Estate.
page.content: The fine{18th Century Hall}built in 1720 on the site of a previous Hall was demolished stone by stone in 1926 and taken to{America}and rebuilt. All that remains now are the foundations and part of the original Estate wall. The former{Lodge House}is still used today. Also,the stables were sold and thatched as cottages. Later an upstairs was added to provide 5 cottages. One cottage has a boarded up {well}in the garden. The present {farmhouse}is sited on and incorporates some of the original outbuildings. The present lounge was the{Cattle Shed}and now has a false floor and ceiling. The kitchen was the{Storeroom. }The present accommodation has had various additions and now forms an L-shape. The farm comprises 120 acres and is farmed by Mr. Haylock, his son and one other. They grow Cereals and Beans.
